text:
Hotel ini tampak biasa saja dari luar, ternyata bagian dalamnya luas dan bersih. Kamar yang kami pesan adalah family room dengan balkon yang menghadap ke kolam. 
Kamar mandinya luas dengan hot water yang lancar, sangat puas mandi disini.
Kolamnya luarrr biasa, salah satu poin plus untuk hotel ini. Bila malas untuk keluar hotel, bisa berenang atau bersantai di tepi kolam.
Menu sarapannya cukup lengkap dengan rasa yang enak, kekurangannya mungkin hanya restoran yang open air, jadi kalau pagi cukup cerah maka bisa agak kepanasan. Dan karena open air jadi beberapa tamu dapat merokok dalam restoran.
title: Kolamnya bagus!

text:
Kolam renang grand palace sanur memiliki panjang sekitar 30 meteran, cukup untuk olahraga di pagi atau sore hari.
Kedalaman 1,1 meter flat dari ujung ke ujung. Tidak ada kolam untuk anak. Handuk selalu tersedia di meja.
Lokasi kolam di samping restoran namun tidak terlalu menjadi tontonan yang sedang makan, tersedia beberapa kamar yang langsung akses ke kolam.
Jam buka mulai 08.00 sd 20.00 wita, saya usul agar bisa mulai dari jam 06.00 karena seperti kami yang jam 08 harus kerja, maka harus dari pagi2 kalau mau olahraga.

text:
We stayed here with our 9-month old son. 

Things we liked 
- The hotel is new and almost everything is in mint condition 
- The pool and buffet area are cosy and well-managed 
- The complementary breakfast buffet offers a great selection to suit all tastes. You can have your eggs done on the spot - just the way you like em. 
- The rooms are spacious and welcoming 
- The staff here were probably the best i've encountered in Bali. They smile, make a point of looking you in the eye and are extremely attentive. 
- The soft music played in and around the hotel added to its ambiance

One minor improvement - the drain in our hotel room clogged up pretty quick so our showers were shorter but that was fine for us.
title: Luxurious, modern stay in Sanur

text:
Clean, great architecture, pleasant room, very friendly kitchen staff.
Down side was luke warm water in the shower, a shallow 1.1 m pool, adequate but not great selection for breakfast, poor location on very busy road, with very broken footpath on way to main shopping areas, watch your step especially at night. Hotel says it provides a shuttle service to beach and shopping, but booking is 1 hour in advance if available and is 1 way only, no return pickups. Massage staff not overly friendly, pretty average and expensive massage, but clean and safe.  Bacon available on special request to kitchen staff, but not on menu.

text:
From the moment we arrived from the airport I was excited.
The foyer deserves the names Grand and Palace.
Staff booked us in to our rooms quickly with no fuss.
The rooms are large even the standard room we had.
The bathroom was one of the best I have seen in Bali.
The breakfast was very generous with a great choice.
Most of the breakfast food will be cooked fresh as it is needed.
The restaurant is large and beautiful.  The pool is also Excellent.
The pool gets all day sun as its a East / West pool so the water is a little warm.
Gede is a wonderful manager who personly came up to me and asked me about my birthday in a few days time and if the hotel could do something for me.
We left before my birthday and moved to legian as planned but he still rang me and wished me a Happy Birthday and to make sure we got to our other hotel safe.
The gardens around the hotel and pool are full of beautiful orchards and other flowers.
Over the road is a very nice restaurant called The Hub Bali for a night out.
There is more restaurants and even a few shops within walking distance.
The only thing i didnt like was the two beds put together as a double.
This has a few problems apart from the hard bit in the middle.
The light switches are now in the middle of the bed behind the pillow and easily turned on in the middle of the night.
Then they use 2 bed covers that don't stay together in the middle.
1 large bed cover would be better.
Would i stay again   YES
title: Excellent Hotel

text: This is a fairly new hotel although if you look closely the finish quality is a little poor - for example raggedy cut edge to the marble around the sink, some joinery etc. I work in construction..most people probably not pick up on these items. Generally nice enough. We booked a pool view - when we got there were given a room looking across to a wall. When we asked they said they had overbooked....My wife used to work in the hotel business so 'went through them for a short cut...' thus we got shown to a pool room....Food decent enough, cleanliness ok,  pool cold - its location means it never gets sun but once you are in for a minute its ok. I hadn't really picked up when booking that the hotel is quite a ways from the beach - about 15mins walk through little narrow back passages. It is set on a busy road but the rooms are quiet. I would have preferred to be on one of the beach front hotels and if I was going back would aim to do so. Overall a reasonable stay
title: Reasonable Hotel, Located on a Busy Road about 15mins walk from Beach

text: My fiancé and I booked this place for one night last minute as we were not happy with the other place we were staying in. Check in was not till 12pm but the staff went above and beyond to get the room ready for us earlier. This hotel is new and everything was absolutely immaculate and well kept. Buffet breakfast was great too, a good selection with a chef making eggs any style, pancakes and waffles etc. The pool area was awesome, wished we had stayed longer!! The only downside was that it was on a main highway and a little inconvenient to get to the main shopping/restaurant strip adjacent the beach but there are many little alley ways and side streets you can walk down to get there.
title: Would recommend!!

text:
Location:  The hotel is in the main road of Sanur area.    Just 3 or 4 blocks to the beach and just 2 blocks away from the shopping street.   Chose this area of Sanur because is the less crowded and traffic is not that bad as in Kuta or Seminyak.  

Sanur area doesn´t have the spectacular sunsets of Kuta, but sunrise is worth to see.   The area has a kind of marine walk, great to walk or run specially at early hours.

Rooms:  Check two or three types of rooms and all of them were comfortable.   Finally got one in the second floor facing  the narrow but nice pool they have.  Bathrooms are ok.  The only BUT I found was the minibar: It didn´t cool as much as you expect from a fridge.   Asked to be changed and they finally did for something much better, but still not cold enough for Bali temperature.

Restaurant: Only had breakfast.   Not with great variety but still good from my point of view.   Had dinner a couple of times and it was good, not fantastic but good.

Facilities:   The hotel has pool, a small garden and shuttle bus twice a day to take you to Sanur shopping and restaurant street.  Has elevator.  Don´t know if the have rooms for elderly or people with disabilities.

Front desk and other employees were very friendly and tried to help in every aspect they could.

One thing I noticed, and I really hope the management takes note, is that the hotel doesn´t have any single signal to mark where the stairs for evacuation are located.  We were in the hotel when Lombok earthquake stroke, Bali also shook badly, and in the middle of the panic many guests couldn´t find the stairs to get down losing precious time in case of disaster.   

Made this same comment to the manager on duty, and I really hope she does something.   I don´t know if this is a common problem in Bali hotels but certainly it seems to be the case in restaurants too.  

This review could have been a 4 but the fact that disaster information is not available I decided to give this property a 3.
title: Nice hotel, close to the beach

text:
We stayed in this hotel as the start of our holiday. We choose this option because it is close to the airport. But to be honest, Seminyak or Kuta are also close to the airport.

The hotel is brand new and the rooms are nice. The staff is friendly and really willing to help you all the time.

We stayed here with our children aged 12 and 9. They also liked the hotel and the swimming pool (although it’s a bit small between all the rooms)

Some comments..... the breakfast was a little bit less and you didn’t have so much options.
The hotel is not really well located. In night time it’s just a dark main road to far away from shops, bars and restaurants.

Last thing and maybe good to know.... the room are really close to the pool and close to each other. When you like to sit outside a little bit private.... you will not find this option here ......

A nice tip: ask the hotel for renting a motorbike. It will only cost you about €4,50 a day but it’s really worth the money and gives you all the freedom you need.

The hotel arranged these motorbikes perfect for us.

Great job by the staff!
title: Good experience but the location......

text:
Spent 10 nights at the Grand Palace Hotel.Booked two pool view rooms on the third floor. The rooms are very spacious, kept immaculately clean like the rest of the hotel, have comfortable beds and good pillows. Good-sized bathroom including large shower cubiicle and good thick towels..The hotel is on a noisy bypass but you cannot hear the traffic in the rooms. Very quiet at night. Large outdoor pool and very comfortable sun loungers. Breakfast was good with a selection of European Indonesian food but could do with another person at the egg station at the busiest time - 9.30am-10.30am and disappointed no freshly-squeezed juice and no cereals, apart from bircher muesli,  provided. My husband loved the muesli
Cons - showers in both rooms barely hot on most days, water pressure low and some days the hot water ran out in the middle of having a shower. Problem reported to reception and for a couple of days we had no issues but the problems returned. Very annoying 
Air con stopped working on the third day but fixed on the same day. However, the remote control didn’t work properly and could not adjust the temperature and fan speed on some days. Tempremental like the shower. Other minor points - no bedside lamps and switches for ceiling lights only on one side of the ned.
The hotel does not have a bar. There is supposed to be a rooftop bar but it is still not open and staff on reception did not know when it will open. The hotel is a 20-minute walk from the beach or 5 minutes by car. Taxis to the centre of Sanur cost no more than AUS $2-$3 and the hotel also runs a free bus shuttle to the main parts of Sanur. Staff at the hotel very friendly and always greet you with a hello.
title: Lovely hotel but could be great with a few improvements

text: My boyfriend and I spotted this hotel on a booking.com and it stood out only because it was surprisingly low price for a nice looking hotel. The staff is very welcoming and helpful, the amenities are great. I loved that there was a small gym and fresh water. The complimentary breakfast buffet is also very good! A wide range of food options are available. We also rented a scooter from the hotel (they are supplied from another company) and it was the same or cheaper than a scooter rental on the strip. We simply gave the key to the front desk when we checked out so we didn’t have to worry about returning it afterwards. The hotel also arranged a shuttle from the hotel the airport which was also a very easy process. Overall excellent place to stay and would recommend to anyone!!!

The room is spacious and clean. 
The spa is under a different company (not the hotel's management) but I hope they can have better communication with the reception. We ordered a honeymoon package which the hotel knew, but the spa company was a bit confused as to what to do. 

We hope they will continue with their motto to keep the hotel peaceful and relaxing. 
We will not hesitate to go back. 

Jenny and Steve UK

text:
We stayed here first week in April 2018 .
I chose this hotel as we wanted a 2 centre holiday , 1st week in ubud in a more tradional resort & I wanted a place near the sea but not to far to travel for the airport for our second week . After reading all the reviews I decided upon the grand palace .
The hotel did not fail to impress & keep a smile on our faces from the minute we arrived until the day we left . There is a lot of talk of the main road outside , yes it's busy & the pavements are terrible , but we found if you turned left out of the hotel & took the first left about 3 properties down , you were into the lanes that led to the town & beach & we're very quite , infact good enough for a couple we met whose husband was in an electric wheelchair to use safely enough to get to the beach every day .
Food was brilliant , we even eat in the hotel a few evenings as we were to tired to go out.
Breakfast was a very good buffet with eggs cooked fresh anyway you liked .
What really makes this hotel though , is not the fact that its immaculate & that in Europe it would cost 3/4 times as much , but the staff ! They are the most friendly helpful lovely people , they take pride in their jobs , wherever it's front desk or house keeping , I have to say that hotels in Europe could learn a lot from the young team here , nothing is a problem & it's all done with a smile & politness that the owners should be very proud of their staff .would I recommend or return ? YES , without even thinking , it's a no brainer .
I have seen the odd report moaning & all getting upgrades , I think you would have to have issues to find something to complain about , my personal thought for what it's worth are these are professional complainers that know how to get a free upgrade . I stay in hotels all over the world for work & personal & yes I've stayed in amazing luxury & also in war torn countries in dumps , but like I say , the STAFF make this hotel , as in most of Bali , customer service is amazing .
title: Amazing hotel & possibly the best staff ever encountered

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Me and my niece travelled to Bali on 18th March.  Our flight was delayed at Heathrow for an hour due to the snow.  As a result we weren't allowed to board our connecting flight from Guangzhou.  As a result of the complete social media blackout in China I called our booked driver and the hotel to let them know we would be late.  The receptionist immediately empathised and reassured us the room would be ready for us whenever we got there.

We were a little concerned that the Grand Palace was on the bypass when we booked.  However our concerns were unfounded as it is more of a dual carriageway by our standards.  

When we did arrive 8 hours later the staff at the Grand Palace were so welcoming and understanding.  They escorted us to our room which was incredibly bright, airy and spacious.  We were in room 130 which was on the corner of the restaurant/pool. It had great air conditioning and the bath robe and slippers were a bonus.

The Grand Palace has only been open for 8 months and is everything you could expect from a new hotel.  The staff were exceptional.  They were so polite, attentive and there seemed to be nothing was too much trouble.  

Breakfast was interesting (in a good way)!  As in large parts of Asia, breakfast included fried rice, fried noodles, chicken and fish.  However there was still a continental breakfast as well as chicken and beef sausages, baked beans (which were much sweeter than we were used to) and grilled tomatoes. If there is nothing 'out' that you fancy you can ask the breakfast staff and they will get it for you. They fry/poach/boil eggs to order. The young trainee Deyu(?) has a great future in hospitality.  

The pool was lovely as was the green (artificial grass) outside our room.  You could use the bean bag loungers or just throw a towel.  The Frangipani trees produce the most beautiful fragrant flowers which land on this green every morning.

We spent much of the day away from the hotel doing what tourists do, sightseeing etc.  So coming back to the peace of the Grand Palace was blissful.  We felt so pampered. The free shuttle was great. We used it a few times to go to the beach.  We did also walk along the very dodgy pavements a fair few times to check out the very local restaurants.  

The Grand Palace is so peaceful despite being on the 'bypass'. So much so that we got ready to go out for dinner and only realised it was lashing with rain when we opened the door. We cannot praise the staff enough for their hospitality.  They really went above and beyond to ensure we enjoyed our stay.  We would most certainly go back.
title: A truly wonderful place to stay

text: Superb hotel and without a doubt the BEST hotel we have ever stayed in not mention in Bali. Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by the friendly reception staff and management. The hotel is GORGEOUS and reasonably priced. The rooms were simply amazing and beautiful. They have the latest appliances, are very spacious and extremely clean & comfortable. The staff were extremely friendly, the restaurant very flexible (appreciate this!) and the Manager-Putra deserves a special thanks. We spent two and half weeks at the hotel which we didn't plan on and which obviously also added up to the experience.  Putra who was very accommodating made our trip more interesting with his advices & tips about the island ,supermarket ,shops,restaurants, shopping markets. They provided shuttle to the beach club and shopping center- no charge. Would definitely recommend this hotel to everybody we know! The atmosphere was so special that it really felt like home to us. All respect for the general manager who does a great job here; It's a true sample of excellent hospitality. Thank you again Putra and staff for going just that little step extra for your guests!!!

text:
we stayed at this hotel for four nights during our trip to Bali. We had two rooms. Unfortunately, the rooms were not next to each other since the hotel was full. The hotel staff were profusely apologetic about this. they did manage to give us rooms close by, which made it work OK for us.

- Location- The hotel is located in Sanur, about 45 mins from airport. Taxi cost Rp 150,000. Suggest booking taxi from Klook.com. The Sanur area is less touristy compared to Kuta or Seminyak. The hotel is not on the beach but about 10 mins walk to Sindhu/Sanur beach. Hotel also has a complimentary are shuttle one way at 4 set times. One downside of the hotel is that it is on a very busy street although does not matter once inside.

- Hotel- this is a newer hotel and I believe it is less than one year old. The lobby is beautiful and has couches for folks to hang out. There is also a gym as well as a spa. The restaurant serves very good food at reasonable prices. The pool is nice and very well-maintained as well. I have to say the highlight of our trip however was the fantastic staff at this hotel. Each and everyone of them was very polite, helpful and attentive. Just for the staff, I would give the place five stars!

- Rooms- rooms are spacious and well appointed. We did have intermittent issues with the Wi-Fi but again, not in Bali to be on the Internet! The bathroom is large. The rooms are very clean with daily housekeeping.
title: Fantastic hotel with outstanding service!

text: This is a new hotel. Very clean, comfortable and beautifully designed and decorated. Very generous amenities in room. The staff is always smiling and as soon as you need anything they are right there. Buffet breakfast was a nice mix of Indonesian and western food. This hotel was my first stop on a tour of South Bali and a great place go unwind after a flight. It is on a main road (highway). The hotel has a shuttle but unlike their description the shuttle will drop you off but doesn't pick you up (blue bird taxi back from beach is inexpensive) and the shuttle leaves hotel only 3 or 4 set times per day. This will probably increase in future as their business picks up. Loved sitting poolside or in restaurant to chill or do work. Wifi was pretty good. Overall great beautiful facility and affordable if you don't need to stay  beachfront. I would definitely return!
title: Exceptional experience.

text: Stayed for a week over Christmas New Year period. Apart from how new and super clean this place is, the real standout was the super friendly staff! Everyone had a smile for you, at least 9 staff knew my name (in itself extraordinary!). Nothing was a problem. The bathroom was impeccably clean and the shower a good strong flow, wi-fi was excellent and the bed very comfortable. Black out curtains, and the fact it is so quiet, ensured a brilliant night sleep - every night. Breakfast buffet is plentiful - and varied. They will cook you an omelette, or any type of eggs, as well as bacon and other things, fresh to order - at the buffet. The restaurant was excellent for dinner and room service quick - all at a reasonable price. The beach is only about a 20 min walk whilst the main street of Sanur with all its restaurant options is just around the corner. The local area (including the area behind the other side of the main road out front) is perfect for a relaxing walk. The spa at the hotel was great. Will be staying here again!
title: Wonderful relaxation. Clean, new, super friendly, great room, food, pool and wi-fi

text:
We stayed here for 8 nights while on holiday. It's a new hotel and is pretty luxurious with large rooms, large pool and easy access to everything. If you don't mind being on the bypass road and not right near the beach it's great. They do a free transport service to certain areas of Sanur which we took advantage of a couple of times and I believe the price for transport elsewhere (Kuta, airport) is pretty reasonable. We mostly walked to Jl. Sindhu when we needed to as it was only about 10 minutes or so, it's just the walk along the bypass road is a bit dodgy with a lot of broken manhole covers and sewer openings to dodge. There is a laneways close by that will take you to Jl. Sindhu though and keep you off the bypass.
We had an executive pool access room which was great, opened right on to the pool and was huge by other hotel room standards we have stayed in. The only downside is the air con is probably too small for the room and struggled a bit to keep up in the really humid/hot days, but was still plenty cooler than outside.
The staff are great and really helpful and always offered us the free transport.
There is a coco mart just up the road, a couple of restaurants either side.....and everything else an easy 10-20 minute walk.
title: Enjoyable & comfortable stay

text:
This hotel is simply but well styled with quality fixtures and furniture. The staff do an excellent job of keeping the hotel spotless with every area well kept. The rooms are all of a good size with a large bed that's incredibly relaxing. Thanks to Novi and Kusumaya who sorted out an upgrade and accommodated our request for adjacent rooms so the family could be next door.
There was good variety of the Balinese and continents breakfast which we enjoyed but dinner at the restaurant is just ok compared to many of the restaurants we dined in while in Bali which were fantastic.
We spend a lot of time by the pool which was very relaxing. The hotel free shuttle is useful as the hotel is located on a fairly busy road which is not pedestrian friendly.
Although the hotel has no control over this, the loud karaoke/music from buildings next door was also an occasional annoyance particularly as we could hear it while we were having what was supposed to be massage in the hotels spa. The staff are the best asset of the hotel, all very warm, friendly and willing to help with any request. Darma, Dwi and Adi were all a pleasure to deal with. We had some challenges during our stay due to Mount Agung eruption and the hotel did their best to help us with our queries, making phone calls to the airline and booking agents, Putra went as far as offering us the use of his personal mobile to make calls.... priceless.
title: Nice hotel with excellent service

owner_response.text:
Dear ANNA B,

Thank you for taking the time to post comments of your experience stay with us. Your positive comments about the hotel, the staff, and the pool are highly appreciated.

We take note of your suggestion. Actually it is our standard to have food and drinks, and other expenses charged to room. Therefore upon check in we request guests to put deposit, and upon check out all the bills will be settled. There are guests who refused to put deposit, and to ensure they understand the consequences that they will be requested to pay cash for every transaction, we request them to sign the Cash Basis Statement Form. I am sorry this was not explained to you clearly. Total guest satisfaction is our utmost priority and it is thanks to your feedback and comments that we are able to maintain and further improve the standards.

In closing, I would like to thank you for choosing Grand Palace Hotel Sanur Bali. We look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.

With best regards,
Julita Chandra
General Manager
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
The hotel is about 45 minutes away from the airport by taxi, The hotel looks great, Nothing less.I must say it's probably the cleanest hotel I ever been to.The staff whoever I was in contact with were all outstanding. They made the stay even better if possible.The room was large and clean, excellent bed, and all amenities you can ask for. There are many restaurants a minute or minutes away ,,,the same goes for shops where you can buy ice cream,,,water, sigarettes..whatever....The beach is in walking distance maybe 10-15 minutes away....
The restaurant in the hotel is also good and I will recommend crispy dusk or spare ribs ( crispy pork )...Excellent staff.....this is also where you get your breakfast. Very good,

I will definately like ot go back to stay at Grand Palace Hotel Sanur. I highly recommend. Very good value for money.... I consider it a 5 star without doubts.  Thank you.
title: A relaxing time in Sanur

text: We stayed at The Grand Palace on two occasions during our trip to Bali, It is a lovely hotel, with fantastic staff.  All staff were exceptional but especially Ricky at Reception.  If you don't mind not being on the beach then this hotel is perfect.  They run a shuttle service a few times a day that will drop you off at the beach or in the main street.  They arranged taxis for us at other times. Rooms are very spacious. Because we were out most of the time we didn't eat there very much, only breakfast once and room service one evening, both were nice. Dinner was very reasonable.  Fridge in room was great to chill drinks for coming back from a long hot day in Bali.  They are working on a roof top bar at the moment, this will definitely add to the hotel.  Although there are good restaurants not too far away and also Mini Market down the street. The main road is very busy and not a great road to walk on but this is not the hotels fault.  Otherwise all good and look forward to visiting again. Thank you for a wonderful stay in Sanur
title: Beautiful hotel with top notch staff

text:
It makes a pleasant change for photos to reflect the actual place. Rooms are spacious, clean and the beds are large and super comfy. 
We had a warm welcome and were upgraded so a great start! 
Breakfast is above average, omelette station where you can ask for several items. 
The pool is really long and fab and not too cold. There are approx 12 sunbeds with extra beany bag cushions, not too crowded but the hotel is not at full capacity. I imagine it might be a problem if it gets full. It would be more comfy if the sunbeds had cushions on them- just a minor point. 
Most rooms overlook the pool and are not that private but you can draw the curtains. A minority of rooms have not got a good view. 
Balconies are spacious. 
We would stay here again for the same price! The beaches in Sanur are not great. There are plenty of restaurants and bars and it's good for a couple of days. 
The staff here are attentive and they work hard. They are also very helpful and pleasant. 
Thank you Grand Palace for a wonderful stay ☺
title: Very enjoyable stay. The Staff are exellent.

text:
We had an unexpected visit to this hotel after leaving our previous hotel disappointed. The universe was definitely feeling kind when it sent us to this hotel! It is brand new and having a soft launch period. The rooms are massive, fresh and clean. The bathroom was lovely and well equipped. We had a pool access room and it was worth every penny. 

During the day, we used the pool, room service and the spa services, all of which were excellent. We are in the restaurant on 2 nights and they were very helpful in accommodating our gluten free requests. If the food or drink we wanted wasn't clearly available, we asked and they got it for us. This included bacon at breakfast and g&ts in the evening. 

The thing that makes this hotel stand out though is the staff. They all looked genuinely relaxed and happy. They helped us, they helped each other; this really helped me relax during my stay. 

The hotel is situated on a very busy road and it's tricky to walk anywhere but not impossible. The hotel were happy to summon taxis for us so eventually we just drove to places that we'd have probably normally walked to. There's a cash point and convenience store next door and the beach is close by. 

I highly recommend this hotel. You will not be disappointed.
title: Outstanding hotel experience

text: Location is good. I was here to experience a tennis camp at Liga Academy across the road, an excellent facility, professionally run. Noise from the main road wasn't an issue, crossing  was  challenging. . There are quality cafes, Joglo, and, Cafe Mural close by, with the restaurants Naughty Nuri's, and, The Hub. A medical centre with pharmacy, physiotherapist  is just down the road. The closet ATM is near a Mini Mart, and, McDonalds five minutes, up the road , fifteen to the beach promenade. The rooms were big, and, spacious, regularly cleaned, serviced,  water bottles replaced every day. The staff were always efficient, courteous, with a big Balinese smile. The breakfast buffet although an extra charge, had many options to choose from. and, was good value. On my last day the room suffered water damage, and, flooding. I have to thanks Kusama the Maintenance Manager who arranged another room for me to rest up, and, refresh after check out, while I waited for my transport to Denpasar Airport to catch my early evening flight home.
title: Centrally located it served my needs perfectly.

text:
A nice hotel, but I am rating for a solo traveller and it is probably not really suitable.

Pool is shallow and really for children, it is located back from the beach having to work through busy traffic and poor pavements to get to the restaurants and beach.

Easy to get cars and taxi's for families making it a base
title: Not for sols travellers

text:
Booked 2 rooms: family and pool view. Family room was okay although the aircon wasn’t great. The pool view room is where we had issue. Booked twin: got 1 bed. Okay could deal with that for 1 night. After pulling back sheets there were blood stains, make up stains and hair IN the bed. Rubbish in bathroom bin, hair on floor and broken hair tie under day bed/couch. 30mins after calling reception house keeping came and removed blanket sheet but left others. Didn’t come back until I went down to reception to complain and requested that they come see room for themselves. As I felt this room was not cleaned and unsafe for my daughter & sister who were staying in this room I requested a room change. After seeing the condition herself she apologized and agreed. Not fun after a full day of travel to move room late at night. They offered compensation but didn’t provide any. They offered to follow up and contact me regarding issues raised. I waited 7 days before contacting them again to discuss. I did get a phone call 10 days after stay with another apology but told that the room change was considered by them an “upgrade” and compensation. They were moved to a twin room no pool view. Not what was paid for. 

No welcome drink, breakfast average- had to ask for bacon. 3 pieces given for a family of 5. They had conference going the night we arrived. Very noisy and more attention given to those guests. The hotel looks lovely from a distance but not up close. Wasn’t expecting 5 star but was expecting clean room and the normal friendly Bali hospitality. Didn’t get either.
title: No attention to detail in cleaning

text: We stayed for 6 nights in an executive suite with pool access purely to relax and unwind and that's exactly what we did. Although the hotel is on the main road there is no noise at all. The staff are very attentive and the breakfast was plentiful. The beach is only a ten minute walk with warungs along the way. I believe there is a shuttle to the beach but it wasn't needed. The road is busy but we felt comfortable with the walk.
title: Very Relaxing

text:
This hotel is very big, it is clean and easy to access from the airport. There are many restaurants close to the hotel so you don’t have to travel far. We were disappointed with how far away from reception our room was, the shower was warm not hot and the lack of plugs in the room. Pool was nice and towels are provided. 
The gym can barely be called a gym, 1 treadmill, 1 cross trainer and a few dumbbells. 
Staff were friendly and helpful. Disappointed there was nothing in our room to mark the last hotel of our honeymoon even though we did mention it when booking- a couple of flowers or something would have been nice.
title: Cheap hotel for airport access

text: Love this Hotel it’s perfect for relaxing , great pool area and pool.lovely large modern rooms ,staff are all amazing. We had the best time.This was our second visit , we all love the relaxing atmosphere .
title: Quiet modern Hotel with amazing staff

text: My daughter and I stayed in an executive suite with pool access, what an excellent choice. The room is massive with an abundance of storage space for your bags and plenty of wardrobe space. The staff are brilliant, 24 hour room service and a gorgeous on site spa.
title: The Grand Palace Hotel - 5 Stars!!!!

text: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. I got a welcome drink when I checked in, and the staff was very friendly.  The room was clean and comfortable, and had an air conditioner that worked well, which is important when visiting SE Asia.  The breakfast was delicious, and had a lot to choose from.  The restaurant was also good for dinner too (had dinner twice there).  The spa was nice and the pool was nice and not too cold.  The only minor drawback was that it was far from the main area in town (Kuta), but the staff is always nice enough to call a cab for you if you need it.  I highly recommend this hotel, and would definitely stay again if I go back to Bali.
title: Loved it

text:
My wife and I decided last minute to book a room at Grand Palace Bali during our last day in Bali. Our flight wasn't until 12AM and our initial hotel couldn't offer a late checkout option. Instead of walking around like zombies in the heat, we decided to book this hotel to be able to shower and rest before our flight, which allowed us to really enjoy our last day at the beach. 

The hotel room was exceptionally clean and nice for such an affordable room. The staff were very polite and nice, and when they learned that we would be checking out the same night, they offered to pack our breakfast up so we could have a meal before we left for the airport. This was such a generous offer and nice gesture. We also used their shuttle service which was offered at select times throughout the day. There was no pick up service, but the walk back to the hotel from the beach was about 15 minutes and taxi services were available as well. 

Overall, great stay and I would highly recommend Grand Palace.
title: Quick stay, excellent service!

text:
After staying in a questionable hotel in Sanur a couple of years ago we were more careful with our booking this time around. We were not disappointed. Grand Palace Hotel was great. We arrived early and so our room was not quite ready, which was no problem as we decided to make use of the spa and had a lovely massage while we waited. 

Our room was on the ground floor and opened up to a small area just to the side of the pool so we could walk off our balcony and around to the pool in seconds. This did mean our balcony was not at all private as people dragged beds to be right in front of our doors, so for more privacy we would suggest booking a room on the first or second floor. We weren't in the room much so this didn't bother us. The room itself was a lovely size and very comfortable, with working air con. 

The breakfast buffet had something for everyone and fresh eggs cooked for you if you order them. The cappuccino at the coffee machine was surprisingly sweet so the filter coffee may be a better option. 

All staff were friendly and helpful, able to answer our questions. The hotel is a great location, just a short walk from the main area of Sanur. They offer a shuttle bus but we prefered the walk as there was a great little coffee shop on route. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to others.
title: Lovely comfortable hotel

text:
The hotel's position is not the best in Sanur, being on a major divided highway with a lot of traffic. However our room was incredibly quiet.
The rooms are large and extremely well appointed with a balcony and a clothes rack for bathers, etc. The hotel was spotless.
The staff are wonderful. Polite, helpful and friendly. They couldn't do enough for us - arranging taxis, booking restaurants, driving us to a restaurant right across the road because of the amount of traffic. We couldn't speak highly enough about the staff.
We would have given the hotel five stars but for a couple of little issues. Firstly there are not enough lounges around the pool. Having said that, we got two every day but we needed to get to the pool maybe a little earlier than we would have liked.
The hot water is a bit of an issue. In our room in the mornings the shower was tepid, however as it is the tropics, it's not as big an issue as it could be in other climates.Still, probably not quite good enough.
The breakfast is OK but not a lot of variety when staying for a week.
Having said that, we thought the hotel was excellent and would have no hesitation in recommending it to other people who want an attractive, reasonably priced four star hotel in Sanur.
title: A lot to like about this hotel

text:
This hotel is immaculate and there are people constantly working to keep it that way. We stayed here 2 nights and had a wonderful experience. We arrived our first night at 2am and they were just as friendly as if it were the middle of the day. We booked one of the rooms that walks out onto the pool and we loved it. I feel it was worth the extra cost. The sun mostly shines of the other side of the pool which can be a pro or a con based on your desires. I just swam to the other side when I wanted a bit more sun. Our room was large, clean, accommodating  and the bed was very comfortable. This was very nice after flying for 29 hours. The showers is clean and water is hot!

We loved the breakfast but we are very open, adventurous eaters. We have an omelette both mornings in addition to fruit, toast and more local fare such as chicken curry, tofu, rice, and potatoes which was all delicious. Restaurant staff was very friendly. At lunch we got the chicken with fried noodles and it had an egg on top served that sambal. Inexpensive for restaurant food and tasty. 

We didn’t not spend lot of time right outside our hotel. Other reviews are correct that it is a busy street but it appeared safe and  somewhat walkable if you are just wanting to roam around. I would have it I was here longer.
title: Beautiful, clean hotel

text:
On arrival the grandeur takes you back, whilst located on a busy road the foyer is a stunning double height room with chandeliers hanging above. A warm welcome by the staff and a quick check in process we made our way to a deluxe room (no balcony). The room is very large, decent bathroom with walk in shower with great pressure. 

The buffet breakfast offers reasonable choices, the pool looks inviting but is cold, which is a welcome relief if not an initial shock. 

The soka spa is good value for a resort / hotel and after sampling several Balinese massages on our travels we opted to try one here - they are so good we had to book another on for our departure. 

The Grand Palace Hotel is immaculately maintained and clean - the staff are constantly present around the pool tidying up collecting fallen flowers, petals and leafs. 

The hotel is a little out of the way from the centre and the main road to walk to the busier part of Sanur and the beach is busy with fast moving traffic and the footpath is a little treacherous - but within 10 mins you’re at the night market and a 15 mins you can be at the lovely beach. 

Definitely recommended, but if you’re expecting a beach resort this isn’t the one for you. 

Tea and coffee making facilities in the room would be useful. 

Very jealous of the ground floor rooms
That have direct access to the pool!
title: It’s all in the name Grand

text:
I looked at many hotels before I booked the Grand Palace, and they all seemed to have swarms of ants or mosquitos, but with the grand palace it was bug free! Wow, the cleanliness and kindness of staff, caterers, the front desk and the cleaners was so lovely. Me and my boyfriend felt welcome and well taken care of.

The pool is usually empty (as I assume most people go to Sanur Beach instead) and it was always nice having a dip in the pool after a nice, long day. If the staff saw us in the pool they would always come over and give us towels too, so tentative. The pool is stand-able in if anyones wondering, but quite lengthy.

The breakfast was lovely, it was a little repetitive but cooked well and I never got sick of it, coffee/tea/water/juice unlimited and some balinese styled food alongside normal pancakes and Hersheys sauce. It was lovely as the staff were alert and ready to say good morning as soon as we walked into the breakfast area. 

The rooms were so spacious, cleaned so unbelievably well, and I'm usually picky with cleanliness. The bathrooms were restocked everyday, so I'd have a new toothbrush given almost everyday (alongside the comb, toothpaste, razor, towels, shaving cream in cute little packaging). The shower was lovely and spacious too, never had a problem.

We ordered food to the hotel quite a lot of times using the grab app, and the hotel staff did not mind, Mcdonalds is a 10 minute walk, 7 minutes-ish to get to a road of local restaurants (with food roughly being 50,000 rupiah) and 'The Hub' restaurant across the street, which is my favourite place to eat! It's quite expensive though, maybe about 10 British Pounds to eat there, 150,000 rupiah. You have to cross a really busy street to get to it through, so the hotel staff help you get to the other side, and a small jump over the the block which divides the road too. A little weird but, worth it. 

To get to Sanur beach for me (and I'm a slow walker) is about 15 minutes, the pavements are weird/not straight/a little broken along this walk, and the roads are busy. You can take an alleyway route instead but I steered clear of this as there's quite a lot of stray dogs. It is a little bit of a walk away from everything, a bit awkward but it saves money I guess. I didn't mind much anyway.

I would recommend not getting the airport shuttle with the hotel, it's quite pricy, Bluebird taxi is like the uber of Bali but it won't take you from the airport to the hotel, but it will take you from the hotel to the airport (weird, I know, but true). You'll get approached by 'fake bluebirds' throughout the whole Bali journey, and at the airport! Don't believe it! Just find someone outside the airport who will take you to the hotel for about 150,000 rupiah. If you can get less, brilliant! Bargain away.

Overall, I'd highly recommend staying at the hotel, went a little off topic but transport is important when the hotel is on a busy road. Although it doesn't sound noisy at all, it's actually lovely and quiet. Enjoy yourself when you go! I'm 19 btw.
title: I will give the best review

text:
We stayed over 3 weeks here and have no complaints at all. Situated on the main road but the rooms are at the back and you hear nothing. The beach is 10 minutes walk but the hotel offers a free shuttle. We stayed in a deluxe room which had plenty of room and over looked a garden, the bed was comfortable and there was one firm and one softer pillow each. WiFi was a good standard and there was HBO on the TV.  Breakfast had plenty of choice from cereals, fruits, noodles, rice, bacon if you ask, choice of eggs, fruit, cake, toast, etc. I would prefer a Lipton breakfast tea which is available in Bali to the one on offer but I usually travel with a supply of PG Tips anyway! The restaurant is open air and leads on to the swimming pool which is clean and a good size. The food is of good quality, I would also recommend the Kaya Manis restaurant which you find by turning right outside the hotel and first right on the right.
All the staff at the hotel are highly courteous and accommodating. I used the hotel taxi pick up from the airport and the Blue Taxi to return, both good services.
I would definitely recommend this hotel for a short or a long stay.

text:
Brand new hotel with beautiful furnishing and modern set up. The best bed I have ever slept in.
However they do not service the rooms until after 4pm, and you need to call reception for an earlier service.
Very friendly staff, however only one of the reception staff had good engish.
The pool is nice and cool, but not suitable for toddlers as there is no shallow end.
There is a laundry right next door for a fraction of the price.
The biggest downfall is that it is on a highway type road, and a 15-20 walk to the beach on very uneven footpath.
You can't hear the road noise once your inside,its just getting to and from places that is annoying.
They have a shuttle that leaves 4 times a day, but no return service.
We paid 30,000idr for a taxi from the beach to the hotel again. Most taxis offer 50,000idr.
Overall with a 2 year old, next time we would stay somewhere closer to the beach and more child friendly.
title: Beautiful hotel but not toddler friendly

text:
We stayed here for 7 nights. 
What we loved: beautiful styled large room,  great view of pool and garden,  comfortable large bed with two each big pillows,  dark room,  quiet,  big shower,  free spacious parking,  free Wi-Fi, very friendly staff,  great security guards, breakfast variety of foods. 
What we disliked: air-con was turned off when room key removed creating horrible muggy uncomfortable on return often making it difficult to sleep,  fridge did not stay cold, TV reception terrible and S OK me channels were unwatchable, not enough toilet paper supplied you are rationed, soaps not replaced daily,  toilet seat not closing properly when sitting on it causing leakage, the lobby entrance needs air-con or fans as its very unwelcoming on arrival entry exiting etc, breakfast foods all cold.

We were asked by management on departure our thoughts on our stay but we responded with it was good. 
With reading others reviews there is similar comments already made about issues we have raised so it's clear management won't change their ways anyway.  So to avoid conflict and ruining our holiday experience this is why manager was not informed.  

I have given a true review of our stay and hope others will take note of my review before choosing to stay or not to stay here.
title: Lovely sized rooms and lovely staff

text:
once inside the hotel the experience is, mostly, really positive 

spacious open modern clean hotel
nice rooms - large and in great condition, good a/c, fab bathrooms
nice balconys 
all good so far

the pool was a great length (though not deep) and hardly used at all by most guests
though there were not a lot of beds around the pool - so often there was no where to sit - probably < 20 beds/beanbags for what must be a 100 room hotel

breakfast was nice - though there is no menu for the items you can order - on our last day i say people with waffles and pancakes - that we had no idea were an option - maybe a menu for these items would be a good idea

so... the location
on a map this hotel looks close to the beach and the road with all the shops and restaurants on
the reality is that you cant get out of the side closest to the beach and it is a good 10-15 min walk, down a busy dual carriageway with a broken pavement that isnt a pleasant walk especially once it is dark
but there are also no options for food close by
there are 4 shuttles a day into the centre of sanur and the beach, but no return shuttles 
based solely on the hotel this would definitely be a 4* review, but the location can't be ignored
title: lovely hotel, rubbish location

text:
Family of 3 , 2A and 1C aged 9yrs.  We stayed in the basic room with two twin beds.  The beds are the equivilant of a King Single.  The room was clean,  air con worked a treat,  desk, safe and nice furnishings.  
Pool was great 1.1 m the whole pool so no deep end.  The sun lounges were mostly used but didnt worry us.  
Breakfast: Good.  Egg Station became a bit busy at times and you had to ask for a few items such as pancakes/waffles/youghurt/bacon /cheese which was slightly annoying as these type of items should be laid out on the buffet.  
Location: this was my only bug bear, 6 min walk mini mart then turn right into street running parallel with beach.  Lots of eating/shops/massage in this area.  Beach is an extra 5-6 mins or so.  When leaving the hotel you have to walk on footpath (broken in parts)  along the main road (bypass rd)  its pretty busy and with a 9 year old it wasnt ideal.   They do have a van which can drop you off round the corner but 4  times a day is really not frequent enough (hourly perhaps?  ) or if they could make an exit/entrance from the back of the hotel to the street behind - that would be perfect.  Dont mind the exercise but the front road is busy.  
Stay Again: ? Possibly,  would depend if the shuttle/van service is increased or if there was an easy exit out of hotel.  Great Hotel overall though.  
Staff were helpful.
title: Great Accommodation Overall

text:
The pool access rooms are…frankly, not pool access! And the pool was freezing! You must be prepared to jump into (just 1.2 mtr) freezing water to get in the pool – you can’t slip in, because the balcony has slip-grip surface that acts like sandpaper on your skin and Velcro on your bathers! You have to be able to hoy yourself out of the water (not so easy after 50!) and you must have leather skin to crawl over the slip-grip. I have the knee and ankle scrapes for memories! My sister’s room was only half over the pool (same price though!), so other guests thought her balcony was a good place to sit and smoke! Guests only spent a few minutes in the freezing water – most of the day the pool was empty! The hotel has fake grass and fake plants everywhere (in Bali???) The food and beverages were not good: cold bacon and cold pasta; dreadful, inedible gado gado; and frustratingly inconsistent - one daiquiri was lovely, the next one was watery and unpleasant. They have an unused coffee machine – but serve the worst coffee and have a machine that spits out odd substances (basically, you can’t drink it!) The staff seemed quite shy and unapproachable – not good problem solvers (they wouldn’t even lend out a pen - actually said they “don’t have pens”!) The ‘manager’ told me to swim with my room card, and to go around the outside of the pool and then the building to get back in my room! Ridiculous! We paid extra for pool access! 
To be fair, the rooms are nice (terrible layout – but generally nice); the shuttle is on-demand, and will drop you anywhere in Sanur; and, it’s not expensive. But it’s just not enough to ever come back here, or recommend to others. 

If they put steps into the pool, and heated the pool a few degrees – then it could be a decent place to come for a holiday (just eat outside the hotel!) If they sorted the restaurant, the coffee, and got confident staff, it could be even be a great hotel…
title: There is no pool access in this hotel! Just wanted to leave!

text:
We arrived in Sanur hopeful given the great reviews of this place.
Problems started straight away.
1. Room wasn’t ready.
2. When they got the room ready they only prepared ONE of our two booked rooms and never brought our bags.
3. When they prepared the other one it was FULL of cigarette smoke and they’d pushed 2 twins together and the bedding didn’t even fit the bed!!?! Thankfully they at least changed that.
4. Their “pool access” is ABSOLUTELY A LIE. 
There is NO WAY to get in to or out of the pool from a pool access room without injuring yourself. No step. No ladder. Worse - when we raised this they said “yes we have lots of complaints” - um fix it then?
5. Their rooms are nice enough and large but the design is bizarre. The toilet is in an alcove closer to one wall and about a metre and a half from the other. They put the toilet paper roll on the FAR WALL so you have to practically leave the toilet to get to it?? The door to the balcony is blocked by a giant desk so you have to squeeze past? The marble floors have been sanded in spots so they’re rough and dull.
6. They’re cheap. They turn your air con off if you’re not in the room so you return to a stuffy, muggy hot room after a day escaping the place. 
7. The food and service are bad. It’s distinctly average food at best but some dishes are utterly inedible, and it takes 20-40 minutes for food and drinks to arrive (and the food is usually cold). The drinks can be great one time then terrible the next. The coffee is so disgusting that it’s undrinkable. You know it’s bad when the instant coffee from your room is actually better.
8. Every single thing you hope goes right goes wrong.

Would NEVER return.
Sanur itself is lovely.
title: Disappointment after disappointment...

owner_response.text:
Dear Eleanor W,

However I truly regret to hear that your room was not ready while you come for check in, our check in time at 2 pm, herewith I ask your apology because make you have to wait for the process of clean room until check in hours.

We’ve been to Bali 8 times before and hadn’t experienced some of the things that went on here, for example when the room was made up daily they would turn off your air conditioner either at the remote control or by removing the keycard from the slot at the entrance. This would explain why at check in I had to beg for a second keycard. Another most unusual thing was that we had to pay cash for room service and the in-house restaurant so we only dined their once as a result as I was insulted that my credit wasn’t good enough for them. I could go on but I’d rather submit a good review than a bad one, this place just didn’t feel welcoming to us.

text:
We stopped at the Grand Palace in Sanur for our first 3 nights of our Bali trip.

It's a really clean, well presented hotel and the rooms are very spacious and huge queen size beds with memory foam mattresses.

There is a good size pool although we never used it.

The breakfast is great! A buffet selection and an eggs station offering cooked-to-order eggs.

The hotel staff were really pleasant and helpful, offering trips to the night market and the beach, even if we missed the set 'shuttle bus' times.

The hotel is on the main dual carriage way running through Sanur and the road is always busy and the foot path is not all that easy to walk up on so may not be suitable for families with young children (unless commuting in a taxi). Although we didn't hear any road noise from our hotel room!

The hotel didn't seem to have a bar, the lift indicated a roof top bar but we wouldn't operate the lift to the fourth floor.

Overall it was a great hotel for us to check into and have 2 good night's sleep before moving on, the hotel would have been better served with bar facilities and may be a little out of town for some guests (it's a 20 minute walk or so to the beach).
title: Good first stop destination

text:
We stayed at the Grand Palace Hotel in June. We booked our accomodation through Webjet and found this package to suit us the best.
As we were traveling without other family members we wanted something that would be nice and quiet and not a resort.
Our room was very spacious, huge king bed desk, large television, small bar fridge, and other furniture, the bathroom was large and very clean, could not fault this at all! 
We had a pool access room which was great to just step out of our door and swim. 
The restaurant was great, we had breakfast and some dinners the food was amazing and the staff were lovely, even remembered our names and room number. 
We also had a very relaxing massage by some very talented therapist and will recommend having a treatment while staying here. 
They offer a free shuttle every few hours throughout the day which takes you to different points along the beach and street where most of the restaurants are. 
The motel is located on the By-pass but you cannot hear the traffic once you are inside the hotel, it is also walking distance to the beach, restaurants, money exchange, shopping and night market but if you need to grab a taxi for your return to the motel after a busy shopping day or the heat has got to you it was only a 50000IDR from Hardy’s supermarket.  
Loved our stay here and would definitely recommend The grand palace hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Sanur 
Oh and we had special swan towels and beautiful rose petals set up on our bed for our anniversary which was a lovely touch on a special day for us 💕
title: Our Holiday without the kids

I am not used to write recommandation, but this time I will to inform potential guest of this hotel.
We booked this hotel based on the nice marketing pictures and the overall positive ratings.(No idea where they are coming from...)
In general the hotel looks modern, but it has no signature. Everything tries to look luxury but is based a bad quality. Whoever build this hotel was only looking for cost und tries to reach max stars for min money.
There is no signature or soul in this "concept".
Bathroom is loud warm and sticky and manythinks looks used, what you are not expecting for an 1 year old hotel. Eg Balcony already rusting...
The main problem I had with this hotel managemnt, is that we had some serious personal reason, why we would like to cancel the remaining nights of our stay here.
The answer of the hotel was, that I have to discuss this with booking.com, because the were setting the conditions.
After spending alot of time and money (several phone calls) to get this solved with booking.com, booking.com informed me, that only the hotel is able to decide about my request. Booking.com was trying by there own to reach a solution with the hotel for me, but without succes.
When facing hotel managemnt with this issue, they just say that they are not willing to let us out of the contract. Even a compromise (e g paying an additional night) was refused.
So we had to pay full amount.
title: Hotel not bad but Management not fair-minded

Staff came around also with the in-house massage salon brochure, prices seemed a bit high. Pool access is probably not designed for older people as there is No pool railings to hold onto on the steps and the steps are quite slippery.

text:
We were looking for luxurious place to stay after travelling in budget hotels for 6 weeks.
My daughter found the Grand Palace in Sanur.
We were warmly welcomed by the staff and given a welcome drink.
Our twin room was very clean, comfortable, modern and very rejuvinating.
The rooms are a great size and fitted out with quality fittings.
Bed is comfortable,AC great.
The negatives are slow and some times not working wifi.
Hot water often not working and pillows are too high to sleep on comfortably.
The road is busy but we had no trouble navigating it.
Extended our stay and stayed a total of 5 nights. Received a slight discount when we asked for one when extending our stay.
Breakfast was delicious. Best coffee we have found in a while.
Staff always happy to help.
Would happily return again.

text:
Stayed here 1 night so we could be near to the fast boat to Nusa Lembongan for a snorkelling trip. 
Don’t be alarmed when you pull up as it’s on a very dirty busy main road but as soon as you walk into the hotel you’re in heaven. 

The hotel is incredible. Everything is so grand it really lives up to its name. It’s all so clean and modern, very peaceful as well wasn’t busy while we were there at all. The pool area is amazing, lovely comfortable beds and beautiful lights around the trees at night. 

The restaurant area is very pretty, overlooks the pool area. Great menu and decent prices. Service was very good all the staff were really friendly. 

The room was amazing and absolutely huge. The bed was so comfy, amazing shower and so much space for cases and clothes. Big wardrobes with gowns and slippers too. 

Still can’t believe the value for money. So many places in the world would charge triple the price of this, it’s so cheap and unreal value. 

The only slight negative was the breakfast, not a great selection and some of the food wasn’t covered over and saw the odd fly around. But you could always eat breakfast elsewhere. 

Would stay here again without a doubt.
title: Amazing hotel amazing prcie

text:
We had a very pleasant stay at the Grand Palace Hotel Sanur Bali. The hotel rates itself as a four-star hotel but our impression was that it could be rated even higher, especially given the excellent level of service by the staff, which was something out of the ordinary. 

It was only recently that the hotel was opened so everything in it is brand new. The hotel has a very elegant, spaceous, open-air, spa-like design that brings to mind both colonial and roman influences. The lobby has a very tall ceiling with a huge chandalier. The common areas have shiny marble details and are sparsely, yet tastefully furnished. In the center of the hotel is a beautifully designed pool with comfortable sofas, next to a well kept garden. Soft jazz is played in the background. The whole place feels relaxed and very welcoming, a safe haven from the very busy street outside, One thing you will notice is how clean the hotel is - the staff is constantly keeping the hotel tidy and in a spotless condition. If a leaf is dropped by the pool, someone is there soon to pick it up. 

The rooms are elegant, generous, very clean and bright. The king-size bed and the bed-linen are very comfortable. The AC  worked well. The room is equipped with a flat-screen TV with international and asian channels (even HBO) and a small fridge (although empty since the hotel have yet to decide what to keep in the mini-bar). The bathroom is nice as well, roomy, sufficiently equipped and the shower works fine. The wifi works well in the room as well as in the common areas. The house-keeping and room-service works perfectly and the rooms are carefully cleaned every day.

The restaurant is good and has a fairly ambitious menu with both western and balinese cuisine. We can especially recommend the Black Pepper Beef and the Mie Goreng with seafood.
The breakfast is at a level to be expected at a four-star hotel with both asian/balinese dishes, fresh vegetables and fruits, juices and standard continental breakfast. Omelette and bacon is prepared upon request. 
The hotel also has a spa (somewhat pricy) and a smaller fitness-room that has modern, new machines that hardly have been used. 

What makes the hotel stand out though is the personal service it offers. The staff, led by mr Putra Iriawan, is young, handsome, disciplined, extremely polite and very attentive. Always greeted us and our baby with a smile, always ready to assist us in any way.
Some examples: Maybe it’s just the balinese way, but the staff always offered to make a fruit smoothie at breakfast for our baby son (we didn’t ask for this). Since we stayed more than 2 weeks we were offered breakfast a la carte at no extra charge. We can highly recommend the Pitaya bowl! 
Whenever we needed to go somewhere (not only to the beach) they didn’t hesitate to transport us, free of charge. When our laundry unfortunately got miscoloured, they took this very seriously, corrected the mistake immediately and charged us nothing as compensation. When we had a problem with the ATM, the hotel loaned us some cash until the problem was solved. Mr Iriawan made personally sure we made it to the airport in time. And so on. 

The only thing missing in the hotel is a proper bar in the restaurant. They only serve cocktails mixed on local liquor, which, quite honestly, is dreadful. They also need to improve the wine list somewhat. Draught beer is not available and the only beer served is Bintang. A roof-top bar is under construction on level 4, but has unfortunately not opened yet. That will increase the quality of the hotel even further. 

The Grand Palace Hotel Sanur is a wonderful place to stay at when you visit Bali. We will definitely stay there again next time. 
We can only give the hotel, mr Putra Iriawan and the rest of his team our very best recommendations.
title: A wonderful hotel

text:
I wrote this review whilst still there: This was a combination trip of business and family.  Still here! Awesome, amazing, accommodating, appreciative, patient, helpful and the list goes on. I wanted to write this Review 4/5 days in, because I’m actually living the moment now! Reviews are all too easy to try and do once you’re gone. I want The Grand Palace Hotel in Sanur to know how well they are doing now, and for any traveller to know that this is one of the best places I have stayed anywhere! Restaurant: great variety, open till 11.00pm everyday, and if they don’t have what you want they will get it! Rooms: beautiful, air conditioned, fresh, clean, well stocked, spacious, modern, fantastic. Again, if anything you want or need, they will do or get for you. 
Facilities: Everything you need: Pool, Spa Treatments, Laundry service, Buffet brekkie to start your day well, free Wi-Fi, TV, beautiful Lobby, immaculately kept several times daily - the beautiful kind & friendly staff NEVER stop (would love to name them all including the Trainees). Putra, you are simply wonderful!
Free shuttle drop off to anywhere you want to go within 5kms. They even went above & beyond when we found ourselves a little lost one day, and came and rescued us!! Always ask how our day was, what we did, where we went etc... 
24 hour room service & reception. 
Family with children friendly. 
Pricing: so very reasonable for what is on offer at this beautiful hotel. Cannot recommend them highly enough. 
PS:  Don't forget about the ladder/steps for the Pool Access rooms LOL!!
***For those who need a personal driver whilst in Sanur, please try Gede of G'Day Bali Tour & Transport Service on +6281 353 3000 36.  Like the Grand Palace staff, nothing was too much trouble; he also goes above & beyond to make your trip memorable and safe. Very reasonable daily rate no matter how many hours. His command of the English language is very good, and his knowledge excellent.  We went to so many places and learned so many things.
title: JUST EXPERIENCE IT FOR YOURSELF!!!!!

We had three nights in the Grand Palace and it was fantastic. The service, the food, the room and the attitude of the staff cannot be beaten. This is a great hotel. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

The only negative was experienced by my wife and it related to the spa which she found to be very poor for the money charged. She had the manicure/pedicure package for $56 which is very expensive by Bali standards, which would be fine if it was a good job- unfortunately it wasn't! She returned to the spa to express her disappointment and her nails were repainted but this did not correct the fact that the nails were not filed evenly in the first instance and the varnish was badly applied on both attempts. After this she went to the local chemist and bought a nail file to redo her nails and varnish remover to remove the lacquer as it was still sticky after several hours. This would have been easy to forgive had this not been one of the most expensive spa experiences available in Bali. So disappointing given our experience at the hotel as everything else had been so positive. Our view of the hotel is that generally everything was exceptional - just don't go to the spa!

text:
We came here for four nights after a couple of days in a Villa in Seminyak and loved it. The place is immaculate, brand new and the staff are amazing. 

We paid £243 for four nights in a pool access room and we booked it the night before which might explain the price but for value for money it can’t be beat. The hotel was very quiet but if it continues to provide the service and value it does at the moment then this won’t last long and neither will the prices, so book it while you can! 

Our room was big, had a flatscreen TV with a few English channels and fridge but no minibar. WiFi was good.

It’s around a 15minute walk to Sindhu beach and we found these beaches cleaner than those in Seminyak. Sunar is fairly quiet compared with Kuta and Seminyak with a number of restaurants and bars.

We ate at the hotel a couple times (menu in photos). We had Beef Thai Salad, Nasi Campur, Quesidilas and Bruschetta, all great and reasonably priced for a hotel.

Pool was a great size and at a warm temperature.

Excursion wise we had a driver called Ketut who we booked out a day at a time at a rate of 600,000/day and he would pick us up at 9/10 and drop us off at 4/5 after taking us to see the sites of Bali. One day he took us to a traditional Bali dance/ceremony, followed by the Bali Safari and Marine Park and then to the Water Temple. Another day we went to visit the rice fields, wood carvers, batik makers, painters and jewellery makers which was great to see, there was no pushy sales either which is what you tend to get in the markets. We then went to the monkey sanctuary and the lewak coffee plantation to see how they made the coffee and of course try it. We are usually beach bums but honestly this made the holiday and Ketut was amazing help. The day we moved from the villa, it was unexpected but we had an encounter with a spider the size of my head and that was it for my partner! He came down at 11pm after a phone call to help us move. I also lost my bank card over there and he offered to lend me all he had til I got sorted with the bank, such a great guy and very knowledgeable of the island. If you want to use him drop him a text or WhatsApp on +62 819-1649-5225, he has allowed me to put it on this review.
title: Book it while you can!

text: As soon as our taxi dropped us at the hotel we were pleasantly surprised with what we saw since the drive from the airport and the surrounding scenery left something to be desired. The hotel definitely lived up to its name as it certainly looks like a grand palace when you enter the foyer/reception and for once the photos did not disappoint and displayed a true representation. The remaining facilities such as the large outdoor pool, garden area, restaurant and gym were all of excellent quality and considerably well maintained. Our room was spacious and very cleanly presented. We chose the family room for four of us which had two adjoining rooms with an interconnecting door. The master bedroom was largely spacious and very comfortable, there was a massive king sized bed for each rom along with a flat screen tv, mini fridge and balcony that looked over pool views. The bathroom was very nice and clean and we especially loved the marble shower. All of the facilities and amenities wouldn't have compensated for the 5 star review without the above and beyond service of the staff. Their service was exceptional; offering advice on where to eat and explore, helping with room facilities such as needing an extra fan, accomodating any specific requests we had, coming to aid when someone was hurt, being very gracious and generous hosts and making time for guests and making us feel welcome and cared for. They also organised free activities for hotel guests to keep the kids entertained, but parents also joined in, such as towel folding art, balinese dance classes, coconut basket weaving etc. The Breakfast Buffet had a mixture of continental and traditional balinese cuisine and we enjoyed the variety during our stay. The hotel was located close to Sanur/Sindhu beach area and it took us only a 10-15 min walk to get to local markets and restaurants. They also often offered to take us to local places with the free shuttle even outside of designated times. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend Grand Palace Hotel to any Bali travellers.

text:
A Lovely modern hotel is the Grand Palace, I stayed one night here and actually changed the booking date twice and each time it was done without issue. From our arrival we were greeted by a lovely gentleman who with a big smile welcomed us to the hotel and carried our bags...once at reception we were greeted with a cool complimentary drink and cool face washer to refresh...we were early for check
In however the staff quickly and efficiently made us comfortable and the room was made available to us early.....the room was clean, spacious and modern, everything work as it should and i could not make fault of the beautifully appointed room, the bed was huge, comfortable pillow topped, the linen of high quality with lots of lovely pillows....quality towels and fittings, the air conditioning was quiet and worked well, a huge range of TV channels to choose from. Our room opened out onto a nice courtyard beside the pool. We walked around the hotel and found the staff to be respectful, friendly and helpful...the decor and gardens looked beautiful and well maintained...the pool is large, however only about 1.1 mtr deep, my preference is for deeper cooler water, however it was clean and not salty and not over chlorinated which i like. 
Breakfast was included in the rate and did not disappoint, there was a lovely huge selection of local hot buffet food as well as freshly cooked omelettes to order as well as bacon if you wished, lovely coffee, hot milk, toast, croissants and lots fresh fruit...service was impeccable with the staff not being too overwhelming or overbearing....the staff were happy and joking with each other and i got a feeling of happiness amongst the staff...this rubs off on guests and its a credit to the management to create a happy culture in the work place. The gym i found to be clean and adequate, however the roof top bar is not finished yet, however it will be sure to be a beautiful spot for a cold drink when it’s finished...wow what a beautiful cieling it has too! ...lovey Balinese creativity. The hotel is just off the beach strip and the walk is not recommended as traffic is busy and footpath shonky, however the hotel offers a free shuttle to the beach and back so take advantage of this when you stay....i would not hesitate to book and stay again...also don’t hesitate to try the Ton-Up bar and grill right next door, lovely welcoming folk, great motorcycle decor and great Mango smoothies and a reasonable price...👌
title: EXCELLENT Hotel, FRIENDLY staff, wonderful stay

text: Staying at the hotel with my partner. Firstly the area of Sanur is a nice getaway from the pace of Kuta. If you are looking to chill out away from pubs and clubs this hotel is great. It is about 20mins walk to the beach and 15min to Tumblingan street where most of the local resturants are. There is a shuttle 4 or 5 times a day. The hotel is very well maintained having only been built in August 2017. Staff were very helpful and polite with good English skills and were happy to engage in conversation about local culture. The food was nice, but adjusted for western taste. Only downside was fairly poor water pressure in the shower. Overall a very nice stay for a cheaper place during a peak season. Compliments to the outstanding Trainee staff working the buffet breakfast deserve full time positions. They were great!

text:
The reviews thus far seem pretty positive so I can't add much more than that to be honest. When I booked it was one of the cheaper hotels and stood out as decent value, upon arriving it exceeded my expectations. Nice clean rooms, good staff, decent facilities, relatively quiet (at least from the back of the hotel)

In terms of location it isn't right in the town but is a very quick uber or grab ride away, and you only have to use these when the transfer van isn't running. The beach is walking distance, maybe 15/20 minutes away however there is a lack of sidewalk so you may prefer to get a taxi too and from the sights. I will flag that this is a bit annoying, but taxis are so cheap (especially scooter taxis) that it isn't an issue. 

Most of the positives have been covered elsewhere, needless to say i would go back here.
title: A nice hotel

found this hotel in trip advisor and stay here for a friend wedding in a venue near the hotel
book for 2 superior room and ask for a connecting room. They tell us that there's 2 connecting room available, but 1 is a deluxe room. then we upgrade 1 room to deluxe & they give us a special price for the upgrade. the deluxe room has pool access and in front of the restaurant
the room is spacious & clean, then we add 1 more extra bed.
Staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel premise is not so big, but its sufficient.
everything is clean. The bathroom is good and they give a lot of towel.
room service food is good and the price is also good. I like the crispy duck
breakfast variety is not the best, but still good. You can request for the baked beans, bacon pork, and steamed rice. The open air resto is giving a different vibe, and you can see the well maintained garden :)

I also order delivery from mcdonalds and they can deliver right to my rooms :)

Fantastic brand new (opened in May-17) hotel in Sanur. Well-build and -maintained, very clean. Comfy and spacious rooms with balcony (2nd and 3rd floors) or terrace (1st floor).
